summary: The Equal Shot Act of 2025, introduced in the Senate, aims to prevent the Small Business Administration (SBA) from discriminating against firearm entities, their affiliates, and firearm trade associations when considering them for financial assistance. The bill clarifies that the SBA cannot adopt policies that single out these groups, ensuring they are treated the same as other eligible applicants under the Small Business Act and the Small Business Investment Act of 1958. It defines firearm-related entities broadly.
